item.title: Estimating the Power Spectral Density of Ambient Seismic Noise
Fourier Transform
item.description: 1 Introduction The $Fourier \ Transform$ convert the signal in one domain to another domain, for instance from time domain to frequency domain. The definition of $Fourier \ Transform$ is given by $$ X(\omega) = \int_{-\infty}^\infty x(t)e^{-i \omega t} \tag{1}. $$ For the operation in programming, we need its discrete form, namely, $$ X(k) = \sum_{n=0}^{N-1}x(n) e^{\frac{-i2\pi kn}{N}} \tag{2}, $$ where, $k$ is the index of the $k_{th}$ frequency point, and we can find the $k_{th}$ frequency like this $$ f_k = \frac{kf_s}{N} \tag{3}, $$ $f_s$ is sampling rate of signal and $f_s=\frac{1}{\Delta t}$.
